title: Call To Action
reference-overview: The Call to Action control is used primarily to get the user’s attention and help them navigate to important pages. In terms of hierarchy, the Call to Action sits in between a text link and the Button control.
reference-usage:
• The Call To Action can be used as sidebar links, login page sign in buttons, subnavigation, or any place the user has the choice to go to pertinent high-level pages on a site.
  • They should not replace the standard Buttons that are used to edit or save data.
  • The function of these buttons is to navigate more than take browser actions.
  • In terms of heirarchy, the Call To Action falls right in between Buttons and text links.
reference-details:
• The Call To Action control can appear in a range of Evolution colors (also see ‘Custom Colors’ in the ‘Get Code’ section above)
  • Optional icons can be displayed to the left of the Call To Action label to help describe the action. These icons can be pulled from the IcoMoon set.
  • The Call To Action contrl can also support an optional arrow icon justified to the right to give the user awareness that they will be taken to another screen.
  • The hover color for each Call To Action container is set systemically by pulling in the darker color from the Evolution Color Palette.
  • The labels used on the Call To Action should be an all-capped white font.
reference-mobile:
• The Call To Action control will span the width of mobile devices.
  • Hover effects will not function on mobile devices
reference-technical:
Cross browser compatibility

IE9 doesn't crop background gradients on containers with rounded corners, so we square the corners of every container so it looks just like IE8.
reference-code-html-content-block-pre-5:
The default background color of the Call to Action is #999999 (gray-dark). In order to have a custom background color for the Call to Action add the following data attribute to the Call to Action container: data-palette-color="".

Choose from the following color options for the value of data-palette-color="":

  • black
  • gray-darkest
  • gray-darker
  • gray-dark
